intro: Gomphrena boliviana, commonly known as the Bolivian plume, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Amaranthaceae family and is characterized by its distinctive, feathery bracts that resemble plumes or pincushions. The plant typically grows in arid or semi-arid environments, showcasing its adaptability to dry conditions. Its flowers are usually pink, red, or purple, and they bloom throughout the growing season. Gomphrena boliviana is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and as a cut flower.
